modules.description: This module defines configuration parameters for block devices, including options for buffering, synchronization behavior, file locking, and sector size. It provides functions to create, serialize, and parse these configurations using file paths and query-style string representations. Use this module to set up and persist block device settings that control disk caching, flush guarantees, and access constraints.

This module enables applications to interact with block devices using Lwt_unix, supporting asynchronous reads, writes, buffer flushes, and dynamic resizing, while handling errors and configuration. It operates on block device handles (`Block.t`), memory buffers (`Cstruct.t`), and configuration objects (`Block.Config.t`), with utilities to serialize device configurations and reconstruct devices from them. Typical use cases include virtualization platforms, storage backends, or systems requiring reliable asynchronous I/O and persistent configuration management for block-level storage.
